The owner of this blog (hoseokie-jung) only logs in to delete things that don't belong (rp requests, other ships, etc) once every couple of months because she has a terrible memory and forgets that this is, in fact, her blog.

title: in every life (i'll always need you)
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2Acq0RA

by mylovejeon

Jimin loves his group, but sometimes it’s hard to be surrounded by happy couples constantly - especially when Jimin is the only one without a boyfriend (or two).
When he finally says (yells) how he feels, he could never have imagined it would change his life.
Now he’s stuck inside a fanfiction, fulfilling the role of Cupid and tasked with getting Taehyung and Jungkook together. But if that’s all he’s supposed to do, why does the world keep resetting every time he succeeds?

summary: Chapter 38
title: Chapter 38
body:
Summary:

Up and coming artist, Jeon Jungkook doesn’t see the harm in agreeing to a double date for the sake of his best friends happiness.

<< / 38 / ?

@johnnysneo @daddyjinmas

@hobi-isadaydream @conslack @bangtannnboyz @agoddessofdestruction @liliumoriental @spongebobgotstruckbylightning @bazingadotbizoff @amk-fairy @constantly-in-limerence @uwu-sebastianstan @myet @canyoucallthiswriting @jiminieschilliepeper @typicaltrashbagg @anonymousyoongi @changbeanbag @unmistakenly-me @jinnybun @instantspot @puptaee @spookypumpkinpeach @momdancingtomcr @annalee0101 @darling-winnie @jungkookssistan 

Jungkook’s hand was warm at the base of Yoongi’ s spine, a firm pressure that kept him grounded as they navigated the streets. Coming up to Christmas, the pavement was crowded with people doing their last-minute present shopping, and if it hadn’t been for the younger boy guiding him, Yoongi would have likely been swept away like a pebble in the ocean.

“You alright, hyung?” Jungkook leant close to whisper and he shivered from the smooth baritone that fell over his ears.

Nodding back, not trusting his voice to hold steady, Yoongi tucked his face further into his scarf. It really was cold today.

“Thank you for doing this, by the way… It means a lot that you’re going along with it.” Jungkook sounded bashful as he rubbed a hand across the back of his neck, tilting his head to reveal his bare throat. The skin looked very kissable and Yoongi swallowed.

“N-no problem,” he coughed out, blushing a bright red immediately afterwards. Damn it!

“It’s just-” the younger boy continued. “I feel really comfortable with you, hyung. Even though we only met a couple of weeks ago! Is that crazy? That I’d rather you be my fake date than anyone else? Tae thinks it’s weird, but Tae thinks everything’s weird.”

“And wonderful,” Yoongi muttered.

“Hmm?”

“Weird and wonderful? It’s sort of a saying?” He wondered when his vocal chords would give out under the stress of speaking. Probably soon. “The two adjectives go together? And, like… Tae seems the kind of person to find something amazing in everything? So, I just… yeah.”

Was there really no god on earth that could just set him on fire right now, please and thank you? Yoongi wanted to die. No, he wanted to kiss Jungkook and then find a tall building to leap off. Perhaps there was a skyscraper somewhere near here – maybe Google maps would help?

The boy walking beside him was silent for a few moments and even that short time span was enough for Yoongi to have his eulogy planned. Then he hummed.

“Yeah, I suppose so. Tae really is one of those people who find joy everywhere he goes. And he’s attractive enough that his stranger habits are endearing rather than creepy.” The boy laughed and there was something self-deprecating about it.

“You’re jealous of him?” Yoongi ventured. “Even though he’s your best friend?”

Jungkook opened his mouth to answer but at that point an elderly couple stumbled into them, hands heavy with shopping bags and mouths pressed tight against the wind. The conversation paused as the seniors righted themselves.

“Terribly sorry,” the man apologised, one hand around his wife’s arm as he helped her to her feet. “So busy this time of year, got my feet knocked from under me.”

“It’s alright, Sir,” Jungkook smiled and Yoongi fell a little harder. “No one was hurt.”

Meanwhile, the old lady had regained her balance and was taking her bags back from Yoongi, who had knelt to collect a few stray items. She patted his cheek gently.

“Your boyfriend is a gentleman.” She announced, loud enough for the other two men to hear.

Yoongi spluttered. “I’m not- I mean, we aren’t. He doesn’t – I am but he’s. Well, uhm.”

But Jungkook was chuckling, tugging Yoongi to his side and tucking him under his arm. “He really is, isn’t he?”

“What are you doing?” The blushing boy hissed, poking his captor in the ribs.

“Ah, you must feel very lucky.” The husband said. “You look very fond of each other.”

“I really am the luckiest man. He’s amazing.” Jungkook pulled Yoongi a little closer to him, leaning down to press his lips briefly to his cheek. It was brief – not even really a kiss – but suddenly Yoongi couldn’t breathe.

He had no idea what game Jungkook was playing, but god he didn’t want him to stop. The warmth seeping from the younger boy was wrapping around him, pressing into his skin, burrowing into his heart. He never wanted to let go.

“You look very happy,” the woman grinned. “Have a good Christmas, you two.”

They said farewell and the couple left. Jungkook didn’t remove his arm from Yoongi.

“Well-” Jungkook began.

“You’re taking this fake dating thing a bit far, aren’t you?” Yoongi interrupted and stopped walking. “Not that I’m complaining, because I’m not, but like, you didn’t need to pretend we were together to that couple?”

“Sorry?” The other boy frowned, bunny teeth biting into his full lower lip, leaving a wet sheen after swiping it with his tongue.

“Don’t do that.” Yoongi closed his eyes, willing himself to stay focused. Fuck he was not going to survive this. The boy was too sweet, too beautiful. He didn’t stand a chance.

“I’m… sorry?” Jungkook apologised, looking like he didn’t know what he was sorry for but still sincere, so sincere. Inside his chest, Yoongi’s heart cried.

“No it’s, it’s ok. It’s my fault. Sorry, don’t listen to me.” He hurried out, already regretting opening his mouth. He glanced at his watch. “And we’re going to be late if we don’t hurry.”

Jungkook looked like he wanted to argue but Yoongi started walking again, pushing through the throngs of people gazing into shop windows so quickly that the younger boy had to jog to catch up.

They reached the restaurant – Ponte Vecchio, the front said – with a few minutes to spare.

“Yugyeom should already be here,” Jungkook said, scrolling through his phone to find the confirmation. “He booked the table.”

Yoongi nodded, stepping closer to the door to examine the sample menu sellotaped to the glass. Lots of pasta. Lots of pizza. His stomach rumbled.

Two arms wound around his waist from behind and he breathed in the faint vanilla cologne that barely masked the natural heady scent of boy and Jungkook. Firm chest pressed against his back, so close that when the taller man tensed, Yoongi could feel the muscles tighten. His breath caught in his throat, mind getting cloudy with strong, Jungkook, perfect, want, want, want.

“Any idea what you want to eat?” Puffs of warm air fell across the back of his neck as Jungkook exhaled, and Yoongi prayed that he didn’t notice he goose bumps rising in response. Get a hold of yourself.

“Not really, maybe the carbonara?” He was proud when his answer came out steady.

“Boring,” Jungkook said, and Yoongi could tell he was grinning.

“Says you, Mister Margherita!”

Inside the restaurant someone stood up, eyes fixed on them, waving with a smiling mouth full of white teeth.

Jungkook lifted a hand from Yoongi’s waist to wave back. “That’s Yugyeom.”

Beside the energetic boy, another face also stood up, though this one looked a great deal less enthused about the meeting, and Jungkook’s hand dropped.

“And that,” the younger boy paused, scowling. “Is Bambam.”

The two men inside abandoned their seats to come and greet them and as they got closer, their features became more pronounced. One of them looked sickeningly familiar.

Suddenly Yoongi wasn’t hungry anymore. Fuck.

“Yeah, I suppose so. Tae really is one of those people who find joy everywhere he goes. And he’s attractive enough that his stranger habits are endearing rather than creepy.” The boy laughed and there was something self-deprecating about it.

“You’re jealous of him?” Yoongi ventured. “Even though he’s your best friend?”

Jungkook opened his mouth to answer but at that point an elderly couple stumbled into them, hands heavy with shopping bags and mouths pressed tight against the wind. The conversation paused as the seniors righted themselves.

“Terribly sorry,” the man apologised, one hand around his wife’s arm as he helped her to her feet. “So busy this time of year, got my feet knocked from under me.”

“It’s alright, Sir,” Jungkook smiled and Yoongi fell a little harder. “No one was hurt.”

Meanwhile, the old lady had regained her balance and was taking her bags back from Yoongi, who had knelt to collect a few stray items. She patted his cheek gently.

“Your boyfriend is a gentleman.” She announced, loud enough for the other two men to hear.

Yoongi spluttered. “I’m not- I mean, we aren’t. He doesn’t – I am but he’s. Well, uhm.”

But Jungkook was chuckling, tugging Yoongi to his side and tucking him under his arm. “He really is, isn’t he?”

“What are you doing?” The blushing boy hissed, poking his captor in the ribs.

“Ah, you must feel very lucky.” The husband said. “You look very fond of each other.”

“I really am the luckiest man. He’s amazing.” Jungkook pulled Yoongi a little closer to him, leaning down to press his lips briefly to his cheek. It was brief – not even really a kiss – but suddenly Yoongi couldn’t breathe.

He had no idea what game Jungkook was playing, but god he didn’t want him to stop. The warmth seeping from the younger boy was wrapping around him, pressing into his skin, burrowing into his heart. He never wanted to let go.

“You look very happy,” the woman grinned. “Have a good Christmas, you two.”

They said farewell and the couple left. Jungkook didn’t remove his arm from Yoongi.

“Well-” Jungkook began.

“You’re taking this fake dating thing a bit far, aren’t you?” Yoongi interrupted and stopped walking. “Not that I’m complaining, because I’m not, but like, you didn’t need to pretend we were together to that couple?”

“Sorry?” The other boy frowned, bunny teeth biting into his full lower lip, leaving a wet sheen after swiping it with his tongue.

“Don’t do that.” Yoongi closed his eyes, willing himself to stay focused. Fuck he was not going to survive this. The boy was too sweet, too beautiful. He didn’t stand a chance.

“I’m… sorry?” Jungkook apologised, looking like he didn’t know what he was sorry for but still sincere, so sincere. Inside his chest, Yoongi’s heart cried.

“No it’s, it’s ok. It’s my fault. Sorry, don’t listen to me.” He hurried out, already regretting opening his mouth. He glanced at his watch. “And we’re going to be late if we don’t hurry.”

Jungkook looked like he wanted to argue but Yoongi started walking again, pushing through the throngs of people gazing into shop windows so quickly that the younger boy had to jog to catch up.

They reached the restaurant – Ponte Vecchio, the front said – with a few minutes to spare.

“Yugyeom should already be here,” Jungkook said, scrolling through his phone to find the confirmation. “He booked the table.”

Yoongi nodded, stepping closer to the door to examine the sample menu sellotaped to the glass. Lots of pasta. Lots of pizza. His stomach rumbled.

Two arms wound around his waist from behind and he breathed in the faint vanilla cologne that barely masked the natural heady scent of boy and Jungkook. Firm chest pressed against his back, so close that when the taller man tensed, Yoongi could feel the muscles tighten. His breath caught in his throat, mind getting cloudy with strong, Jungkook, perfect, want, want, want.

“Any idea what you want to eat?” Puffs of warm air fell across the back of his neck as Jungkook exhaled, and Yoongi prayed that he didn’t notice he goose bumps rising in response. Get a hold of yourself.

“Not really, maybe the carbonara?” He was proud when his answer came out steady.

“Boring,” Jungkook said, and Yoongi could tell he was grinning.

“Says you, Mister Margherita!”

Inside the restaurant someone stood up, eyes fixed on them, waving with a smiling mouth full of white teeth.

Jungkook lifted a hand from Yoongi’s waist to wave back. “That’s Yugyeom.”

Beside the energetic boy, another face also stood up, though this one looked a great deal less enthused about the meeting, and Jungkook’s hand dropped.

“And that,” the younger boy paused, scowling. “Is Bambam.”

The two men inside abandoned their seats to come and greet them and as they got closer, their features became more pronounced. One of them looked sickeningly familiar.

Suddenly Yoongi wasn’t hungry anymore. Fuck.

summary: [ARTICOLO] Il cantautore MNEK parla dei BTS e della canzone scritta per il gruppo   “MENK, il cantautore inglese tre volte...
body:
[ARTICOLO] Il cantautore MNEK parla dei BTS e della canzone scritta per il gruppo 

“MENK, il cantautore inglese tre volte nominato ai Grammy, si è recentemente incontrato con TV Report a Seul per discutere della sua musica, dei suoi fan in Corea e della sua collaborazione con i BTS. 

Durante l’intervista ad MNEK è stato chiesto se fosse a conoscenza dei suoi numerosi fan in Corea. L’artista ha risposto: “Ad essere onesto non lo ero. Penso che molti dei miei fan coreani mi abbiano scoperto attraverso i BTS. Come sai, una delle canzoni che ho scritto è stata inclusa in uno degli album della serie ‘Love Yourself’. Ho ricevuto un sacco di messaggi positivi sui social da parte dei fan dei BTS. Se le persone mi conoscono in Corea, probabilmente è grazie a loro.” 

L’intervistatore ha poi continuato a discutere del rapporto di MNEK con i BTS e ha chiesto al cantante se ci fossero dei retroscena del processo di produzione della canzone. MNEK aveva precedentemente complimentato il gruppo per essere “super talentuoso e davvero gentile” durante un’intervista con Billboard.

In risposta MNEK ha commentato: “Non sono ancora riuscito ad incontrarli. Ci è stato possibile organizzare questa collaborazione attraverso un produttore statunitense. È avvenuto nel periodo in cui mi ero appena lasciato con il mio partner quindi stavo passando un momento difficile. Scrissi due tracce chiamate ‘Phone’ e ‘Mouth’. ‘Mouth’ è diventata ‘Paradise’ dei BTS. Allora ‘Mouth’ parlava della separazione di una coppia e della tristezza di un cuore rotto. Il testo è cambiato dopo che la traccia è passata ai BTS.” 

Ha continuato: “Penso che si siano ritrovati nella melodia. Questo è il lato divertente della musica: anche se le lingue sono diverse, la musica ci unisce comunque visto che possiede qualcosa a cui tutti possiamo relazionarci.” 

MNEK ha aggiunto: “Quando ho sentito ‘Paradise’, mi è piaciuta davvero. Ovviamente non ho potuto comprendere il testo perché era in coreano. Mi ci sono ritrovato lo stesso e mi è ritornata come una traccia profondamente toccante. I BTS hanno un fanbase forte. È perché condividono dei messaggi importanti e perché sono un grande gruppo.”

MNEK ha recentemente rilasciato il suo album “Language” a settembre e gli è stato finalmente possibile incontrare RM dei BTS una volta arrivato in viaggio in Corea. Entrambi gli artisti hanno condiviso le foto del loro incontro sui loro account Twitter.”

Traduzione a cura di Bangtan Italian Channel Subs (©lynch) | ©soompi

title: in every life (i'll always need you)
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2Acq0RA

by mylovejeon

Jimin loves his group, but sometimes it’s hard to be surrounded by happy couples constantly - especially when Jimin is the only one without a boyfriend (or two).
When he finally says (yells) how he feels, he could never have imagined it would change his life.
Now he’s stuck inside a fanfiction, fulfilling the role of Cupid and tasked with getting Taehyung and Jungkook together. But if that’s all he’s supposed to do, why does the world keep resetting every time he succeeds?

summary: Christmas Lights
title: Christmas Lights
body:
BTS au one-shot

Jimin x Reader Y/N

Fluff, Romance

Word Count: 1,318

A/N: This was a request 💜

gif made by me

As soon as you park your crappy car along the curb in front of your boyfriend’s apartment, you crank the heat up as high as it will go. You’ve been putting off getting the heater fixed for a while but now it’s frikin freezing and you’re regretting it. Your breath comes out in foggy puffs in front of your face as you hold your fingers up to the vent. A pathetic stream of warmish air sputters out, doing nothing to penetrate your frozen skin. With a miserable whine you grab your phone out of the cupholder and try to press the home button with your numb finger. Nothing.

“Come on,” you growl and make a tight fist in an attempt to get some blood flowing into your hand again. After a few more tries, your phone screen comes to life and you immediately open up your text conversation with Jimin.

Hey, are you awake? I’m outside.

It takes you longer than it should to get your thumbs to cooperate enough to type the message but finally you press send and lean back in your seat, tucking your hands under your thighs in an attempt to warm them up a bit. Despite how absolutely subzero it is, you’re still excited. Sure, it’s one in the morning and you can feel icicles forming in your nose but the thought of surprising Jimin with a romantic Christmas outing makes your insides feel all warm and fuzzy.

Your phone lights up in your lap and you squint from the sudden brightness as you read his response.

Outside?? What are you doing here?

Now that your hands have warmed up a bit, you’re able to type much faster.

Just dress warm and come out here

Then you lock your screen again and settle back in your seat. You close your eyes and try really hard to think of some place warm and you can almost begin to imagine it when suddenly there’s a hard knock on your window. You don’t catch the scream before it jumps up your throat and you bolt upright in your seat. Jimin peers in at you in confused astonishment from the other side of the glass. With a quick breath to try to steady your racing heart, you motion with your head for him to get in on the other side. He gives you another confused look but complies anyway, his eyes never leaving yours as he makes his way around the front of the car.

At last he gets in and turns to you.

“Are you crazy?” he asks tugging his scarf up over his chin.

“Crazy about you,” you joke and completely fail at keeping your teeth from chattering.

Jimin’s mouth purses as he tries to keep from smiling at your cheesy pick-up line. “Your lips are turning blue.”

“Then come over here and warm them up for me,” you utter, this time not even trying to hide the fact that you’re shivering.

With a chuckle, Jimin leans across the middle console, takes your face in his warm hands and pulls you to him. Ugh, his mouth is so warm and so soft and you feel like you could just stay there kissing him for the rest of your life—or at least the rest of winter—but you have an agenda. And making out with your boyfriend—no matter how enticing that sounds—is not on it.

Reluctantly, you pull away, placing one more sweet kiss on that perfect mouth of his before leaning back to meet his eyes. “I have a surprise for you,” you say with a smirk.

A confused smile spreads across his own lips and he tilts his head. “A surprise? For me?” The slight irritation that tinged his voice when he first got into the car is long gone. You knew he wouldn’t be able to resist a surprise.

“Belt on,” you say before clicking your own. Jimin reaches back quickly and tugs his own belt on before you even shift into gear and you can’t help but laugh at the way his legs now bounce excitedly as you pull away from the curb.

You drive for a while in silence as Jimin looks out the window on his side. It’s been snowing for a few days now so everything is covered in a blanket of white and now it sparkles in the moonlight. You can’t wait to get where you’re going so you can see the look on Jimin’s face when he sees everything. You know he’s going to love it.

“Are we almost there?” he asks you.

You only nod, keeping your eyes glued to the road. The pavement glitters with frost and you’d rather not end up sliding into a ditch so you drive extremely carefully and slow. Luckily most people are smart enough not to be out at this time of night so you’re the only car on the road.

Jimin rests a hand on your thigh. “Can I have a hint at where we’re going?”

Now you shake your head as a smile creeps onto your face. “Almost there,” you say.

Just a few more turns and at last you’ve reached your destination. Jimin lets out breath and his eyes widen as he looks at all the colorful Christmas lights lining the houses on either side of the street.

“When I was younger, my family had this tradition every year where we’d come to this neighborhood and look at all the Christmas lights and drink hot chocolate.” Then you reach into the back and retrieve a thermos full of still steaming hot chocolate and hold it out to Jimin. “It was one of my most fond holiday traditions and I wanted to start it up again this year with you.”

Jimin takes the thermos from you and looks down at it in his lap. Then up again at the lighted street. Then down again at the thermos. Finally, he looks over again at you. “My family didn’t really do stuff like this,” he says quietly. Then he lifts his hand to tuck a strand of hair back up under your hat, his fingers lingering on your cheek. “This is the best surprise ever.”

You smile back at him, your heart hammering in your chest, your stomach doing flips. The two of you have been together for a little less than a year yet he’s still able to make you so nervous and flustered. “Just wait till I give you your Christmas present.”

His smile stretches even wider, making his eyes shrink into sweet half moons and he leans in to touch his mouth to yours. The brush of his lips, the feel of his fingers still stroking your cheek, the colorful lights that reflect off his skin. None of it seems real. Your head is swimming by the time the two of you separate again.

“I love you, Y/N,” Jimin whispers and you feel you breath hitch.

Did he really just say that? Are you hearing things? Are you so wrapped up in this moment that you imagined it? No. No, the way he’s looking at you. The way he bites at his bottom lip in anticipation. He definitely said it.

“I love you too, Jimin” you say and the words feel so strange on your tongue but so right. As if you’ve never spoken truer words in your life.

Jimin smiles again—his face is going to be so sore tomorrow with all this smiling—then twists the lid off the thermos and takes a sip of hot chocolate before passing it over to you.

The liquid is sweet and so so hot and it warms your insides immediately. The air coming out of the vents has finally started to actually warm up the car and now you settle into your seat comfortably before easing off the break and starting down the street.

“When I was younger, my family had this tradition every year where we’d come to this neighborhood and look at all the Christmas lights and drink hot chocolate.” Then you reach into the back and retrieve a thermos full of still steaming hot chocolate and hold it out to Jimin. “It was one of my most fond holiday traditions and I wanted to start it up again this year with you.”

Jimin takes the thermos from you and looks down at it in his lap. Then up again at the lighted street. Then down again at the thermos. Finally, he looks over again at you. “My family didn’t really do stuff like this,” he says quietly. Then he lifts his hand to tuck a strand of hair back up under your hat, his fingers lingering on your cheek. “This is the best surprise ever.”

You smile back at him, your heart hammering in your chest, your stomach doing flips. The two of you have been together for a little less than a year yet he’s still able to make you so nervous and flustered. “Just wait till I give you your Christmas present.”

His smile stretches even wider, making his eyes shrink into sweet half moons and he leans in to touch his mouth to yours. The brush of his lips, the feel of his fingers still stroking your cheek, the colorful lights that reflect off his skin. None of it seems real. Your head is swimming by the time the two of you separate again.

“I love you, Y/N,” Jimin whispers and you feel you breath hitch.

Did he really just say that? Are you hearing things? Are you so wrapped up in this moment that you imagined it? No. No, the way he’s looking at you. The way he bites at his bottom lip in anticipation. He definitely said it.

“I love you too, Jimin” you say and the words feel so strange on your tongue but so right. As if you’ve never spoken truer words in your life.

Jimin smiles again—his face is going to be so sore tomorrow with all this smiling—then twists the lid off the thermos and takes a sip of hot chocolate before passing it over to you.

The liquid is sweet and so so hot and it warms your insides immediately. The air coming out of the vents has finally started to actually warm up the car and now you settle into your seat comfortably before easing off the break and starting down the street.

Jimin x Reader Y/N

Fluff, Romance

Word Count: 1,318

A/N: This was a request 💜

gif made by me

As soon as you park your crappy car along the curb in front of your boyfriend’s apartment, you crank the heat up as high as it will go. You’ve been putting off getting the heater fixed for a while but now it’s frikin freezing and you’re regretting it. Your breath comes out in foggy puffs in front of your face as you hold your fingers up to the vent. A pathetic stream of warmish air sputters out, doing nothing to penetrate your frozen skin. With a miserable whine you grab your phone out of the cupholder and try to press the home button with your numb finger. Nothing.

“Come on,” you growl and make a tight fist in an attempt to get some blood flowing into your hand again. After a few more tries, your phone screen comes to life and you immediately open up your text conversation with Jimin.

Hey, are you awake? I’m outside.

It takes you longer than it should to get your thumbs to cooperate enough to type the message but finally you press send and lean back in your seat, tucking your hands under your thighs in an attempt to warm them up a bit. Despite how absolutely subzero it is, you’re still excited. Sure, it’s one in the morning and you can feel icicles forming in your nose but the thought of surprising Jimin with a romantic Christmas outing makes your insides feel all warm and fuzzy.

Your phone lights up in your lap and you squint from the sudden brightness as you read his response.

Outside?? What are you doing here?

Now that your hands have warmed up a bit, you’re able to type much faster.

Just dress warm and come out here

[[MORE]]

Then you lock your screen again and settle back in your seat. You close your eyes and try really hard to think of some place warm and you can almost begin to imagine it when suddenly there’s a hard knock on your window. You don’t catch the scream before it jumps up your throat and you bolt upright in your seat. Jimin peers in at you in confused astonishment from the other side of the glass. With a quick breath to try to steady your racing heart, you motion with your head for him to get in on the other side. He gives you another confused look but complies anyway, his eyes never leaving yours as he makes his way around the front of the car.

At last he gets in and turns to you.

“Are you crazy?” he asks tugging his scarf up over his chin.

“Crazy about you,” you joke and completely fail at keeping your teeth from chattering.

Jimin’s mouth purses as he tries to keep from smiling at your cheesy pick-up line. “Your lips are turning blue.”

“Then come over here and warm them up for me,” you utter, this time not even trying to hide the fact that you’re shivering.

With a chuckle, Jimin leans across the middle console, takes your face in his warm hands and pulls you to him. Ugh, his mouth is so warm and so soft and you feel like you could just stay there kissing him for the rest of your life—or at least the rest of winter—but you have an agenda. And making out with your boyfriend—no matter how enticing that sounds—is not on it.

Reluctantly, you pull away, placing one more sweet kiss on that perfect mouth of his before leaning back to meet his eyes. “I have a surprise for you,” you say with a smirk.

A confused smile spreads across his own lips and he tilts his head. “A surprise? For me?” The slight irritation that tinged his voice when he first got into the car is long gone. You knew he wouldn’t be able to resist a surprise.

“Belt on,” you say before clicking your own. Jimin reaches back quickly and tugs his own belt on before you even shift into gear and you can’t help but laugh at the way his legs now bounce excitedly as you pull away from the curb.

You drive for a while in silence as Jimin looks out the window on his side. It’s been snowing for a few days now so everything is covered in a blanket of white and now it sparkles in the moonlight. You can’t wait to get where you’re going so you can see the look on Jimin’s face when he sees everything. You know he’s going to love it.

“Are we almost there?” he asks you.

You only nod, keeping your eyes glued to the road. The pavement glitters with frost and you’d rather not end up sliding into a ditch so you drive extremely carefully and slow. Luckily most people are smart enough not to be out at this time of night so you’re the only car on the road.

Jimin rests a hand on your thigh. “Can I have a hint at where we’re going?”

Now you shake your head as a smile creeps onto your face. “Almost there,” you say.

Just a few more turns and at last you’ve reached your destination. Jimin lets out breath and his eyes widen as he looks at all the colorful Christmas lights lining the houses on either side of the street.

His smile stretches even wider, making his eyes shrink into sweet half moons and he leans in to touch his mouth to yours. The brush of his lips, the feel of his fingers still stroking your cheek, the colorful lights that reflect off his skin. None of it seems real. Your head is swimming by the time the two of you separate again.

“I love you, Y/N,” Jimin whispers and you feel you breath hitch.

Did he really just say that? Are you hearing things? Are you so wrapped up in this moment that you imagined it? No. No, the way he’s looking at you. The way he bites at his bottom lip in anticipation. He definitely said it.

“I love you too, Jimin” you say and the words feel so strange on your tongue but so right. As if you’ve never spoken truer words in your life.

Jimin smiles again—his face is going to be so sore tomorrow with all this smiling—then twists the lid off the thermos and takes a sip of hot chocolate before passing it over to you.

summary: [ARTICOLO] YouTube, Instagram e Oricon tirano le somme per questo 2018 e i BTS non mancano di essere presenti “Il 19 dicembre...
body:
[ARTICOLO] YouTube, Instagram e Oricon tirano le somme per questo 2018 e i BTS non mancano di essere presenti

“Il 19 dicembre YouTube ha rilasciato una lista dei 10 video musicali K-pop più popolari e visti di quest’anno.

I dati sono stati raccolti dal 24 novembre 2017 al 23 novembre 2018. Per la top10 dei video oltre l’85% delle visualizzazione sono in media provenienti da fuori la Corea, dimostrando quanto grande sia la presenza dei gruppi idol coreani in tutto il mondo.

I BTS hanno preso il secondo, il terzo e il quarto posto della classifica, rispettivamente con “Fake Love”, “MIC Drop (Steve Aoki Remix)” e “IDOL”.

Nel mentre, anche Instagram ha annunciato i propri risultati per gli Instagram Awards 2018.

I BTS hanno vinto come Top Boy Group, categoria per cui solo account ufficiali gestiti dalle agenzie dei gruppi con il maggior numero di follower si sono qualificati.

Per la categoria Photo With Most Likes ha vinto il post dei BTS con la foto scattata a maggio ai Billboard Music Awards (BBMAs) 2018, la quale ha accumulato 3,2 milioni di like.
Anche il fandom dei BTS (ARMY) è stato incoronato Top Fandom Community sul post Year In Review di Instagram.

Per concludere, Oricon ha pubblicato le sue classifiche musicali di fine anno per questo 2018.

Questo 20 dicembre ora locale, la classifica musicale giapponese ha rivelato le posizioni per la sua 51esima edizione di fine anno, un sunto di tutti i successi musicali del 2018.

I BTS sono ai primi posti non solo per i “Top Foreign Album Rankings” con il loro ultimo lavoro, “Love Yourself: Answer”, ma anche nei “Top Album Rankings” (dove “Face Yourself” si posizione al settimo posto, “Love Yourself: Answer” al quattordicesimo e “Love Yourself: Tear” al diciottesimo) e nei “Top Single Rankings” (dove “Fake Love/Airplane Pt. 2” conquista la posizione n.12).

Congratulazioni ai BTS per i successi di questo 2018!”

Traduzione a cura di Bangtan Italian Channel Subs (©lynch, Clara, jimindipityR) | ©soompi

summary: Koreans Vote For Artists Who Shined The Most + Favorite Songs And Idols Of 2018
title: Koreans Vote For Artists Who Shined The Most + Favorite Songs And Idols Of 2018
body:
New Post has been published on http://www.btsvfan.com/koreans-vote-for-artists-who-shined-the-most-favorite-songs-and-idols-of-2018/

Koreans Vote For Artists Who Shined The Most + Favorite Songs And Idols Of 2018

In addition to previously released polls on the top comedians, drama stars, and movie stars of 2018, Gallup Korea has now revealed results for the artists, songs, and idols who were most loved this year.

Gallup Korea has been holding this survey annually since 2007. This year, 4,200 people between the ages of 13 and 59 located all around the country were surveyed in July, September, and November.

The margin of error is ±1.5 percent at the 95 percent confidence level.

For the first question, respondents were asked to list up to three of their favorite artists or groups from this year.

The top 10 responses are as follows:

1. BTS (24.4 percent)
2. TWICE (11.0 percent)
3. IU (10.2 percent)
4. Hong Jin Young (8.8 percent)
5. Wanna One (8.2 percent)
6. Red Velvet (7.8 percent)
7. BLACKPINK (7.6 percent)
8. Jang Yoon Jung (7.2 percent)
9. Lee Seung Chul (6.1 percent)
10. Cho Yong Pil (5.5 percent)

These are the top 10 chosen by respondents from each age group:

BTS rose two spots from 2017, and their percentage increased by almost 16 percent. TWICE remained in second place for the third consecutive year, with their percentage increasing by 1.9 percent from last year. IU also stayed in the top five with a percentage of 10.2.

Hong Jin Young and Wanna One entered the top five for the first time.

Check out the top five for each year since 2007:

The respondents were also asked to list up to three of their favorite songs in 2018 (although not necessarily released this year).

The top five are as follows:

1. BLACKPINK – “DDU-DU DDU-DU” (5.0 percent)
2. BTS – “IDOL” (4.4 percent)
